publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3704 Mike Pringle: Justice for Medical Staff in Libya—That the Parliament notes the continuing plight of the five Bulgarian nurses and Palestinian doctor in Libya who were given death sentences last year after being found guilty of infecting 400 children at the al-Fateh Children’s Hospital in Benghazi with HIV, despite significant evidence to the contrary; further notes that their appeal hearing was, last month, postponed until next year and that supportive organisations around the world, including the Royal College of Nursing, are asking people to send them Christmas cards to demonstrate the level of support they have over their seventh Christmas in prison and also to let the Libyan authorities know that others are watching the judicial process, and supports the political and diplomatic efforts of the European Union and the United States of America aimed at securing their release. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-3704 Mike Pringle: Justice for Medical Staff in Libya—That the Parliament notes the continuing plight of the five Bulgarian nurses and Palestinian doctor in Libya who were given death sentences last year after being found guilty of infecting 400 children at the al-Fateh Children’s Hospital in Benghazi with HIV, despite significant evidence to the contrary; further notes that their appeal hearing was, last month, postponed until next year and that supportive organisations around the world, including the Royal College of Nursing, are asking people to send them Christmas cards to demonstrate the level of support they have over their seventh Christmas in prison and also to let the Libyan authorities know that others are watching the judicial process, and supports the political and diplomatic efforts of the European Union and the United States of America aimed at securing their release.
S2M-3704 Justice for Medical Staff in Libya (lodged on 8 December 2005) Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-3704 Justice for Medical Staff in Libya (lodged on 8 December 2005) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-3704 Justice for Medical Staff in Libya (lodged on 8 December 2005) Elaine Smith*
